bug.author: CristXu
bug.summary: The example does not work, got a error: 'QuantizeAwareActivation' object has no attribute '__name__'
bug.description: Hi, After run the code to save the model, it complaints that: 'QuantizeAwareActivation' object has no attribute 'name'; So I add a self.name = ‘’ to the line 107 of quantize_aware_activation.py and i can save the model. But i think this is not a legal way to solve the issue. and My env is : tensorflow-gpu == 1.14.0 and the tensorflow_model_optimazation == 0.2.1 compiled from the newest github's code Thanks for your help Regards

comments.comment: Please follow the bug template and as a part of it, provide a fully reproducible example (including a model). It's not specific enough to know which "example" you are referring to. 1.14.0 will also not be supported at launch. Only 2.0+
